[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

src_text: Hodo wiye, Sara Danius weyi ɛkɛ Tɔm Maʋ Nobɛɛlɩ tɛ kɔɔmiite takayaɣ taa mayʋ yɔ, ɛyɔɔdɩ samaɣ taa raadiyoo Sveriges Suyɛɛdɩ taa se kɔɔmiite tɩpɩzɩ nɛ kɩyɔɔdɩnɩ Bob Dylan kɩ-maɣmaɣ se kiheyi-i se ɛnʋ wabɩna se ɛmʋ 2016 Tɔm maʋ Nobɛɛlɩ Kɩhɛyʋʋ, nɛ pʋyɔɔ lɛ kiyebi pana ñaɣʋ se kɩyɔɔdɩnɩ-ɩ.
ref_text: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hyp_text: However, Sara Danius, the head of the Swedish Academy, has announced that the Nobel Prize in Literature will not be awarded this year, citing Bob Dylan's refusal to accept the prize in 2016, and stating that the Academy will not nominate anyone else for the award.

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

src_text: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ Komina Sɔsɔʋ kʋyaa nɛ kɩcɛlɩ liidiye nɛ pama Mersey Đɔkɔtɔ ŋgʋ kɩwɛ Devonport, Tasmania egeetiye taa yɔ, egeetiye taa komina nɛ ɛjaɖɛ paɣtʋ lɩzɩyaa nabɛyɛ pɛwɛɛ nɛ pɔyɔɔdʋʋ tɔm kɩdɛkɛdɩtʋ paɣtʋ takayaɣ ŋga kɔ-yɔɔ, pamaɣzɩɣ se pɩkɛ kpaca pañɩba se pʋcɔ nɛ pɔtɔ caca sɔsɔʋ ɛjaɖɛ ŋgʋ pakaɣ labʋ Kamɩŋ fenaɣ taa yɔ.
ref_text: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

src_text: Perry yɔɔdaa se ɛkaɣ ʺpɩsʋʋ Texas nɛ ɛtazɩ mbʋ pɩlɩ ɖoo anɛ a-tɛ caca tɔʋ taa yɔ, nɛ mana se nʋmɔʋ nakʋyʋ wɛɛ se matɩŋ-kʋ caca ŋgʋ kɩ-taaʺ, ɛlɛ pʋwayɩ lɛ ɛyɔɔdɩ se ɛkaɣ wobu pɩ-yɔɔ caca ŋgʋ kɩ-taa nɛ ɛmaɣzɩ ɛ-tɩ nɛ lalaa Karoolini caca tɔʋ kajalaɣ ñɩŋgʋ ŋgʋ pakaɣ labʋ Kɔlaɣ fenaɣ kɩyakʋ 21 wiye yɔ kɩ-taa.
ref_text: Perry stated that he would "return to Texas to assess the results of tonight's caucus, determine whether there is a path forward for myself in this race", but later said that he would remain in the race and compete in the January 21 South Carolina primary.
hyp_text: Perry claims that he's the 'rightful' governor of Texas and that the election was stolen from him, and that the people are waking up to the fact that he is the one who should be in charge, but so far, he has not been successful in his efforts to take over the government, and it's unclear what his next move will be, possibly a coup, as he has been secretly meeting with Karolina, the leader of a militia group, and it's rumored that he has been planning something big for November 21st.

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

src_text: Princeton Sukuli Kɩtɛzʋʋ ŋgʋ kɩwɛ Etaazuuni nɛ Uppsala Sukuli Kɩtɛzʋʋ ŋgʋ kɩwɛ Suyɛɛdɩ yɔ pa-taa ñɩnɩyaa yɔɔdaa se sumaɣ kɩfalaɣ ŋga kalɩ kpanɖaŋ naalɛ ɖeke taa na, paa pamaɣzɩɣ se lɛɣzɩtʋ ndʋ tɩkpakɩɣ alɩwaatʋ sakɩyɛ nɛ pɩkpaɖɩ yɔ, pɩlɩɩnɩ tɛtʋ taa Darwin sumaɣ ŋga payaɣ se Geospiza fortes nɛ sumaɣ Geospiza conirostris ŋga kalɩnɩ ɖoli nɛ kɔkɔɔ peeɖe, palʋlʋʋ taa.
ref_text: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
hyp_text: Princeton University and the University of Uppsala have a long-standing tradition of scientific collaboration, and it is said that the two universities have been exchanging students and professors since the 17th century, with a focus on the study of evolution, particularly in the field of ornithology, where they have made significant contributions, including the discovery of new species such as Geospiza fortes and Geospiza conirostris, and their findings have been published in various scientific journals.

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

src_text: Aloma fenaɣ kɩyakʋ 6 wiye pɩnaɣ 1789 taa, kɩyakʋ taa halaa samaɣ nakɛyɛ kpa Wiyaʋ Louis XVI, Abiɖe Marie Antoinette mba sɔɔndʋ kpaɣaɣ-wɛ pɩdɩɩfɛyɩ yɔ nɛ pe-piya cikpesi naalɛ (Marie Therese weyi ɛwɛnɩ pɩnzɩ 11 yɔ nɛ Louis-Charles weyi ɛwɛnɩ pɩnzɩ naanza yɔ) nɛ Wiyaʋ kɔɔ, Đoɖoo Elizabeth, nɛ ɖoŋ se pakʋyɩ Versailles nɛ pɔɖɔ nʋmɔʋ nɛ papɩsɩ Paarii.
ref_text: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
hyp_text: The French Revolution began on July 14, 1789, when the Third Estate, comprising the commoners, clergy, and nobility, stormed the Bastille, a symbol of the absolute monarchy, and executed King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, and her children, Marie-Thérèse and Louis-Charles, on the grounds of treason, and the National Assembly declared the establishment of the First French Republic, with King Louis XVI's wife, Queen Elizabeth, and her brother, Duke Philippe Égalité, at the helm, and the royal family was forced to flee to Versailles, leaving behind their opulent lifestyle and the palace, and eventually, the family was imprisoned in the Temple Prison in Paris.

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

src_text: Payaɣ piya nzɩ se ʺkpanzɩyaaʺ yaa ñɩtʋ taa piya. Ɛyaa nabɛyɛ kɛzɩnɩ piya kpanzɩyaa mba kɩjaʋ (ɖoŋ ɖoŋ lɛ sɩ-maɣmaɣ sɩ-lʋlɩyaa) ; hɔɔlɩŋ nɩɩyɩ taa lɛ, piya lɔʋ mbʋ pɩlɩnɩ ɛzɩma pɩɣa wɛnɩ ɛjandʋ sɔsɔtʋ natʋyʋ maɣzɩm taa yaa tomnaɣ yɔɔ nɛ lʋlɩyaa kizi-kɛ yɔ.
ref_text: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
hyp_text: It seems that 'kpanzɩyaa' is a phrase that means 'to be stuck' or 'to be trapped'. The speaker says that it's a phrase they use when they're feeling stuck or trapped in a situation, and they're not sure how to get out of it. They mention that it's a common phrase among their friends, and they often use it to describe feeling overwhelmed or frustrated. [Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.

[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Paa mbʋ yɔ, Pɛliziki nɛ Suwiisi ñɩma mba pɔyɔɔdʋʋ fransɩɩ yɔ, pɛkpɛlɩkɩ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ sukuli taa, ye mbʋ papɩzɩɣ nɛ panɩɩ mɩ-tɔm paa ɩlakɩnɩ tʋmɩyɛ fransɩɩ sɔsɔʋ kɩgalʋʋ kɔyɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system."}

[Kabiyè]: Waasɩ wɛɛ nɛ sɩɖɛɣ lɛ, ɛyaa ma tendemee tɛtʋ ndʋ pɩkpɛdɩsɩ-tʋ nɛ tɩwɛɛ culaaa yɔ tɩ-yɔɔ nɛ piwolo pɩtalɩ teŋgu nɔɔ yɔɔ kajalanzɩ.
[English]: {"translation": "Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea."}

[Kabiyè]: Sanzɩ baril waa kudokiŋ sakɩyɛ kpɛdɩ Fairbanks hadɛ kiŋ, Alaska taa nɛ pɩtɛ lɛ, paɖɩɣ Trans-Alaska tɛtɛɛ nʋmɔʋ ŋgʋ kɩ-taa sanzɩ tɩŋʋʋ yɔ miles waa 800.
[English]: {"translation": "800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska."}

[Kabiyè]: Pɛlɩzɩkɩ hɔɔlɩŋ weyi ɩwɛ sɔnɔ yɔ, ɩɩkɛ Lukizɛmbuuri hɔɔlɩŋ caanaʋ taa,ɛlɛ ɩpɩsɩ Pɛlɩzɩkɩ ñɩŋ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ lʋba se kɩwɛɛ kɩ-tɩ yɔɔ pɩnzɩ 1830 waa taa nɛ pɩtɛ yɔ.
[English]: {"translation": "Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution."}

[Kabiyè]: Kpaɣnɩ alɩwaatʋ ndʋ papaɣzɩ tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ Onion yɔ, ɖɩpɩsɩ hoŋa tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ sɔsɔyɛ siŋŋ, ɖɩwɛnɩ tɔm susuu takayaɣ hatʋ ñɩŋga, ɛntɛrnɛɛtɩ lone nɖɩ ɖɩhɔm ŋgee ɛyaa 5 000 000 Aloma fenaɣ taa, kɩ-tɛ adɖɛɛsɩ, tɔm susuu tʋmɩyɛ ɖʋtʋ ñɩɣtʋ 24 evemiye taa, podcast waa, nɛ pitileɖi yɔ, palɩzɩ ɛjaɖɛ aŋjaʋ atlas ŋgʋ payaɣ se Our Dumb World.
[English]: {"translation": "Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World."}
